messages.text:
Heya New Ventures leads :wave:

*This is your weekly reminder to please update the Weekly Team Update Notes before standup on Monday:*

• :dance: Shared Team Members: <@U03TY4YJU4X> <@UEZ4PRFKM> 
• :dog: The Pets Table Squad: <@U03UMPD2NNS> <@U8F7ZDAPM> 
• :meat: GoodChop Squad: <@U01AKGWGLC8> <@U027201FQSV> 
• :world: Market Innovation & Optimization Squad:  <@U02CRDYF2NL>  <@U01BT6RE4JG>
• :muscle:  Factor Form Squad: <@U09D8BZ9891>  <@U01V9SX5NG5> 
Weekly Standup Notes for the New Ventures Tribe can be found <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1w_XOLs9WPoFBbz3GNjOxDpXGYVGlq7noplV26ZILCEU/edit?tab=t.0|here>

We are getting this message in our PRs in web repo.

messages.text:
Another question whom should we add as "Stakeholder approval form" for our PRs? Is PM enough?

```Use the Updated PR Template: The frontend developers MUST include the following information in the description of every PR:
- Potential risk section
- Potential business impact	
- Potential customer impact
- Stakeholder approval form```

messages.text:
Hi <@UEZ4PRFKM> <@U03TY4YJU4X>!

On Monday we have an Approved Deployment day.

*Approved Deployment Days:* Allows merges for services using Progressive Delivery or not on Opt-In list. For any service not using Progressive Delivery or that is on the Opt-In list, a Tribe Lead (Engineering or Product) must explicitly approve and a “*peak-approved*” label must be added to the PR in Github.

Do you want us to send you the list of PRs or how would you prefer?

Do you want us to send you the list of PRs or how would you prefer?

messages.text:
Quick heads-up on a growing problem: the new room assignment for WoCo means that our tribe + the AX folks on the 3rd floor are essentially out of meeting space,  since we lost *Panna Cotta* and *Gulab Jamun*.

Finding a spot for a simple standup is already a challenge (we are having a room on a 4th floor), and it's going to be a disaster when everyone is back in 2026.
Office Management <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C046QQ3TVJ5/p1763459311701469|isn't responding to our team's request>.  <@UEZ4PRFKM> <@U03TY4YJU4X> You are probably in the best position to raise this issue and ask office management for solutions.

elements.text:
Hi everyone,
A quick heads-up regarding meeting room availability on the 3rd floor:

With the Works Council (WoCo) moving into their new space, the meeting rooms

, effective immediately.

All existing and future bookings in these two rooms have been removed.

Please update any recurring meetings you may have scheduled there.
All other 3rd-floor rooms remain available as usual.

Keep a look out in your email for more information on larger company seating changes coming later this week.

attachments.fallback:
[November 18th, 2025 1:48 AM] hf.workplace.office: :loudspeaker: *Meeting Room Update – Ritterstraße*

Hi everyone,
A quick heads-up regarding meeting room availability on the 3rd floor:

With the Works Council (WoCo) moving into their new space, the meeting rooms *Gulab Jamun* and *Panna Cotta* are now *exclusively reserved for the WoCo*, effective immediately.

All existing and future bookings in these two rooms have been removed.
 :point_right: Please update any recurring meetings you may have scheduled there.
All other 3rd-floor rooms remain available as usual.

Keep a look out in your email for more information on larger company seating changes coming later this week.

You are probably in the best position to raise this issue and ask office management for solutions.

_thread_replies.text:
*tl;dr:* Folks, unfortunately, there is no quick solution to the issue at hand.

*Context:* Unfortunately, for cost-saving reasons, the ground floor quiet area will be subleased to another company, which means that that space will become unavailable for HF. Unfortunately, legally, WoCo does need access to secure, private rooms. Furthermore, because it's a "smart building" it's impossible to create additional meeting rooms quickly.

*Immediate Solution:* We increase the usage of Mezzanine, the meeting room in the Mezzanine and the long table in the corridor on the other side of our room.

*Mid-Term Solution:* The mezzanine space will be improved and separated into sections to increase access and utilization of the space. There will be a conference space, a individual meeting space and an easy way to get to the meeting room without disturbing participants in the conference space. The workspace team will consider increasing the quantity of phonebooths as well to compensate partially.

elements.text: Folks, unfortunately, there is no quick solution to the issue at hand.

Unfortunately, for cost-saving reasons, the ground floor quiet area will be subleased to another company, which means that that space will become unavailable for HF. Unfortunately, legally, WoCo does need access to secure, private rooms. Furthermore, because it's a "smart building" it's impossible to create additional meeting rooms quickly.
We increase the usage of Mezzanine, the meeting room in the Mezzanine and the long table in the corridor on the other side of our room.

The mezzanine space will be improved and separated into sections to increase access and utilization of the space. There will be a conference space, a individual meeting space and an easy way to get to the meeting room without disturbing participants in the conference space. The workspace team will consider increasing the quantity of phonebooths as well to compensate partially.

_thread_replies.text:
Does WoCo need the 2 big rooms on the 3rd floor?
As of now there is no room that is enough for our squad to meet.

My proposal:
• free up gulab jamun (so that our teams have space for standups / groomings etc. and change it to a small room e.g. Brownie. 
• any chances that we could make the nursing room available to take meetings? It can be booked for all times it is needed for mothers, but most of the times the room is empty anyways.

any chances that we could make the nursing room available to take meetings? It can be booked for all times it is needed for mothers, but most of the times the room is empty anyways.

_thread_replies.text:
That does seem to be the case, as they host parallel meetings, and they do have a legal entitlement for a specific space. BUT, why don't we want to use the big room in the back of the mezzanine? It should fit the whole team actually? + there is the big 10 person table in the corridor (there is nobody there, so can/should be used for grooming/planninbg for sure?

Nursing - yeah it's a good point, I don't think it's used for that; but worth checking with the broader team.

messages.text:
Hey eng leads <@U027201FQSV> <@U8F7ZDAPM> <@U01BT6RE4JG> <@U01V9SX5NG5>,

As part of peak prep for our TRE, we are being asked by the platform team to fill out this peak readiness <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/11cl2poqrYjnT9DIxyPTRZunzRD-FlVZoG1wf_AxT7jk/edit?gid=1356933285#gid=1356933285|checklist> per squad outlining our alerts and monitoring dashboards. Its also a good exercise to confirm we have adequate observability and alerting to ensure system stability during peak

Alex has already started this for GoC but can I ask the other leads to take a look and add their alerts/current dashboards pls- we ideally want this filled out by the end of next week Dec 5th. If dashboards don't exist, lets align how we can quickly leverage existing telemetry to create something in HoneyComb

files.name: 2026 Peak Prep - Web & React Native Clients Checklist
files.title: 2026 Peak Prep - Web & React Native Clients Checklist
